alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 01 at 3:06PM MDT until April 05 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and near-blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 or more inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...East-central Wyoming including Douglas, Lusk, and Wheatland. Highest snowfall totals possible along the Pine Ridge. * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
